ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Good basic foundational knowledge of German

I developed a strong sense of communication in a new language. This developed an ongoing relationship with learning German. I would also add that my comprehension skills were also increased by learning German. Lieselotte Sippel was able to give me constant feedback on every assignment, in class, and assessment, which also strengthened my knowledge, skills, and insight.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The strength of this class is the constant communication between the student and the professor. However, a strength and a weakness would be the workload. At times, the workload can be manageable, while other times it may not. It depends on the student and their ability to juggle the workload between all classes.  Another strength would be the 4/1. The 4/1 is to be in class four times a week and have Asynch work on Friday. This gives the student time to work alone and solve problems through hardships.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, great as far as language courses go
I would. Good professor, high workload but it's mostly just busy work

I would certainly recommend this course to another student due to the fact that Lieselotte Sippel is amazing at helping students who have never spoken the language before gain a greater understanding of the language within a month of constantly practicing the language. Alongside the constant feedback, the student would know what part of the language needs to be worked on and what they're doing great on.
